BR_text.BRsummary: build AirSim on custom environment on Ubuntu 16.04
BR_text.BRdescription:
I followed Airsim instruction from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Microsoft/AirSim/blob/master/docs/build_linux.md>here</denchmark-link>
 .
 However, when I run UE it complains about the following missing modules:
 libUE4Editor-Rodain.so (which is my project's name)
 libUE4Editor-AirSim.so
 and asks me to rebuild my environment and I say yes.
 After that, I got a compile error.

 I updated my clang -- version to 5.0.2 and it didn't worked
 Any ideas?

comments_0.comment_text: Same Issues can't even open blocks get the same error and with my custom projects.Ubuntu 16.04 updated clang as well

comments_1.comment_text:
Can you folks please sync to the change made in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/AirSim/pull/1470>#1470</denchmark-link>
  and let me  know if you are still seeing the issue?

comments_2.comment_text:
The pull request solved it, but I had to delete my local copy of AirSim and run step 3 from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Microsoft/AirSim/blob/master/docs/build_linux.md>install and build on Linux</denchmark-link>
  all over again

comments_3.comment_text: I met the same error when I use UE 4.18, then I develop it in 4.20..
